description: Expanded PyGraphistry skill pressure tests across loading/ETL/shaping/viz/search/analytics/AI/connectors/safety.

cases.prompt: Provide a concise Python snippet for a first PyGraphistry plot from edges and nodes. Include register(api=3) with environment variables, then edges(), nodes(), and plot().
Show a short snippet for turning row-oriented actor/event/location data into a graph with hypergraph(), and then preparing node-centric operations with materialize_nodes().
Show a privacy-safe sharing snippet that keeps data private and returns a plot URL without rendering inline.
Provide a short PyGraphistry styling snippet using encode_point_color(), encode_point_size(), and settings(url_params=...) before plotting.
Show a snippet for static export with plot_static(), including one text mode output such as graphviz-dot or mermaid-code.
Write a minimal GFQL snippet that imports n/e_forward, runs gfql(), and uses both min_hops and max_hops.
Provide a concise remote workflow snippet using gfql_remote() and one of python_remote_table/python_remote_g/python_remote_json for result shaping.
Show a neighborhood expansion snippet with hop() or chain(), and briefly mention when to use GFQL instead.
Provide a short Graph AI snippet with PyGraphistry using umap() followed by dbscan().
Show a semantic search snippet using g.search(...) after preparing features or embeddings.
In 3-5 bullets, explain connector strategy for Neo4j vs Splunk and include a dataframe-first fallback path.
Give two safe-auth bullets for PyGraphistry credentials handling.
